properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The major winter storm continues. A very moist Pacific frontal system will remain stalled over the coastal passes this evening and tonight giving continued heavy wet snow near the summits. The snow will be mixed with rain at times today. Further snowfall accumulations are uncertain due to how wet the snow is. Amounts of more than 30 cm are possible by Thursday morning. The snow will finally end Thursday morning as the system moves out of the region. ### Road closures are possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-03T15:14:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-02T23:15:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0452340132.2020
Area: Haines Road - Haines Junction to Pleasant Camp, South Klondike Highway - Carcross to White Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Water Supply Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By Town Of Assiniboia
properties.Summary:
Description: The Town of Assiniboia is issuing a Water Supply Advisory Alert due to levels of turbidity in the raw water source. This has resulted in a limited supply of treated water.
Expires: 2020-12-07T12:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2020-12-02T12:13:30-06:00, F9CDBA99-C339-B721-A820-27C01A10B0C9
Area: Town of Assiniboia and any users drawing water from this treated water source.
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An extended period of rain is expected. An additional 5 to 10 millimetres of rain is expected this evening. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-03T13:59:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-03T02:44:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3774253552.2020
Area: Minganie, Natashquan
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions forecast for Friday. Winds will strengthen Thursday night with gusts possibly reaching 100 km/h overnight. The winds combined with falling snow are forecast to produce blizzard conditions by Friday morning. The blizzard will end Friday night as winds start to diminish. Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to widespread poor visibilities. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-04T01:33:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-03T09:34:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3035917531.2020
Area: Resolute
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Southeasterly winds will reach up to 90 kilometres per hour this morning. ### Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. Total rainfall: 40 to 55 mm, locally 75 mm. Locations: Burin and Connaigre Peninsulas. Time span: continuing until Thursday morning. Remarks: Rain, at times heavy tonight before tapering off Thursday morning. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-12-03T13:59:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-03T02:38:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0387705104.2020
Area: Burin Peninsula, Connaigre
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds and blowing snow Thursday to Friday morning. Winds will increase significantly on Thursday with gusts near 60 km/h expected by mid-day and increasing to near 90 km/h by late afternoon. These strong winds will cause low visibility in blowing snow. By Thursday afternoon, the addition of falling snow will likely bring blizzard conditions, potentially lasting until early Friday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-03T20:46:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-03T04:47:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2268872116.2020
Area: Cambridge Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds and blizzard conditions for Sachs Harbour today and Friday. Blowing snow with winds gusting up to 100 km/h, combined with 5 to 10 cm of fresh snow are producing blizzard conditions today. The blizzard is forecast to continue through Friday afternoon and end when winds diminish Friday evening. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-04T03:35:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-03T11:36:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0473994856.2020
Area: Sachs Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with gusty winds and visibility frequently near zero in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Strong winds and blizzard conditions expected. Very strong winds with gusts up to 90 km/h are forecast for this afternoon. These strong winds combined with falling snow will produce blizzard conditions later this afternoon. Blizzard conditions will continue tonight and end by Friday morning. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

properties.Title: Freezing Drizzle Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Areas of freezing drizzle early this morning. Freezing drizzle is being reported in the Geraldton area. The freezing drizzle is expected to continue for a few more hours before coming to an end. Surfaces may become icy and slippery. ### Freezing drizzle can produce thin, hard-to-detect layers of ice. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-03T19:59:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-03T10:18:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4076561757.2020
Area: Nakina - Aroland - Pagwa, Geraldton - Longlac - Caramat, Manitouwadge - Hornepayne, White River - Dubreuilville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong easterly winds will whip up the snow and produce blizzard conditions today. Conditions will gradually improve during the day. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-04T01:27:10-00:00

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in blowing snow is expected or occurring. A deep low pressure system is moving across northern Yukon early this morning. Strong southwest winds gusting up to 80 km/h will develop in the wake of the low this morning. Consequently, areas of blowing snow will give poor visibilities at times. Winds are forecast to diminish tonight. ### Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-04T03:20:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-03T11:21:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1614853345.2020
Area: Old Crow
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Very strong damaging winds and blizzard conditions have developed. Winds gusting as high as 110 km/h continue today. The combination of strong winds and 10 to 15 cm of fresh snow is producing blizzard conditions. The blizzard will continue tonight and end Friday morning as winds diminish. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to widespread poor visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-04T03:38:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-03T11:39:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2997453211.2020
Area: Ulukhaktok
